results.title: Meditation
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Meditation is an ancient practice used to enhance enlightenment by altering metabolic processes to induce restfulness. Business people, patients and school students, in fact, everyone can benefit from the various therapies shwon if meditation is part of a daily routine.

results.title: Movement
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
This program introduces two natural therapies to change bad posture habits; the Alexander technique which corrects bad posture and increases the performance potential of athletes, singers, musicans and dancers; and the Feldenkrais method which enables people to alter poor movement habits. Includes footage of Alexander and Feldenkrais.

results.title: Spectacular canyons
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Uses diagrams and spectacular photography to introduce the geomorphological agents involved in the creation of canyons. Covers rivers, valleys and glacial valleys showing the processes of weathering and erosion. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Lakes, rivers and other water sources
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Investigates the earth’s major sources of fresh water (lakes, rivers and underground water). The origins of this water, the action of rivers, how lakes clog up, the forces that create the underground water supply and the way in which these major sources of fresh water are interconnected are also considered. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Geysers, lava & hot spots
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Uses the existence of geysers and lava flows as evidence of the heat inside the earth. Investigates the ways in which these hot spots were created and how they are different as well as looking how their energy can be harnessed by humans. Also provides a simple explanation of the formation of the earth.

results.title: Land that came in from the cold
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Shows the ecological succession which has been associated with the retreat of the ice sheet in the Glacier Bay area of southeastern Alaska over the past two hundred years. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Potkoorok
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on the novel of the same name by Patricia Wrightson, this is the story of Simon Brent, a city boy sent to live with country relatives after the death of his parents. He resents the move to a different lifestyle and is bored with country life until he meets some ancient creatures that have inhabited the area since Dreamtime. In this episode he stumbles upon The Potkoorok, a fierce and loathesome creature.

results.title: Turongs
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on the novel by Patricia Wrightson, this story of Simon Brent, the city boy who comes to live with his country relatives after the death of his parents, follows the adventures of Simon and his cousins as they meet and battle menacing creatures from the Aboriginal dreamtime. In this episode the intrepid adventurers come face to face with the Turongs.
results.description:

results.title: Simon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
A television adaptation of Patricia Wrightson’s novel of the same name, this series is the story of Simon Brent, a 10 year old city boy who is placed in the care of country relatives when his parents are killed in a car crash. Simon finds life very boring until he explores a nearby swamp, where he experiences some odd happenings and finally meets a strange swamp creature called The Potkoorok. From that time on, life is considerably more exciting, mysterious and dangerous for Simon and his relatives, Charlie and Eddie, as they do battle with a menacing giant rock known as The Nargun.
